intro: Calymenia chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean calymenia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, with five petals and numerous stamens. Calymenia chilensis is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline environments.
